Key Match Events: Pakistan stuns New Zealand in T20 World Cup semifinal at the SCG with seven-wicket win
New Zealand struggled on a slow, dry pitch, making 4-152
Babar Azam (53) and Muhammad Rizwan (57) gave Pakistan a perfect platform from which to reach their target
Post-Match Reflections: Kane Williamson says New Zealand were outplayed
Muhammad Rizwan wins player of the match
Miscellaneous Highlights: Pakistan will now take on England or India at the MCG, the same venue where they won the ODI World Cup in 1992
Pakistan will find out their opponents in the final tomorrow night
Others: Pakistan has beaten New Zealand by seven wickets to reach a third T20 World Cup final

Having won the toss and chosen to bat, New Zealand struggled on a slow, dry pitch, making 4-152 thanks in no small part to an inspired rearguard innings from Daryl Mitchell (53 not out off 35) and Kane Williamson (46 off 42)

Finn Allen (4) endured an eventful opening three balls, smashing a four down the ground, getting given out LBW — which he managed to overturn on review thanks to a thick inside edge — before Shaheen Shah Afridi completed the job with a gorgeous inswinger next ball anyway
Devon Conway (21) and Williamson rebuilt slightly before Conway was run out by Shadab Khan
Glenn Phillips (6) came and went, caught off his own bowling by Mohammad Nawaz
Williamson and Mitchell put on 68 for the fourth wicket before the New Zealand skipper was bowled by a brilliant Afridi slower ball
Jimmy Neesham (16 not out) came in to help New Zealand limp to 4-152
